basics.name: Brian Rackle
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a consistently recognized top performer and passionate software engineer.

work.summary: Scum master and technical lead tasked with bringing together newly formed team.
highlights: Guided SaaS product through three successful releases leading to the renewal of high value contracts.
Completed highly critical and techinical development tasks quicker than previous estimates.
Improved excel export task to use costant memory on execution server and database server while maintaing performance.
Creation of secure impersonation service with active directory integration for easier customer deployments.
Lead improvements to release process, scrum practices and bug filing
Identified as best engineering hire of 2015
Company elected member of culture club to represent all of engineering.
Elected member of core values ten person committee. Further voted into the three person values finalization team.
Improved release processes and developed scrum standards.

work.summary: Started as junior engineer and promoted to lead in August 2010. Developed tools for graphics and geometric operations in GIS.
highlights: Developed highest performance database operations for performing geometric overlays.
Developed multi-threaded tools for raster and DEM analysi, such as identifying spot hieghts for contours.
Created C++14 API for easy python interop to allow for easy integration of scripts into compiled tools.
Created of tools of for automated map sheet production, also known as the 'Make Map Button'
Creation of web based tool for managing GIS production environments. Included task assignment, progress tracking, QA, and charting for easy understanding of project status.

work.summary: Developed GIS tools for the AutoCAD environment and eventually in charge of coordinating work of all interns.
highlights: Integrated “Customer Involvement Program” into the Map 3D product to track over 400 program events and user interactions to aid in development of AutoCAD Ribbon UI.
Improved speed of AutoCAD Map3D geometry snapping by several hundred percent leading to much more responsive GIS editing.
Developed a debugging tool to determine equivalency in geometry for testing editing tools.

awards.title: Graduate with distinction
awards.summary: Graduated with recognition from the department of computer science for outstanding performance.
